tuv.seg: Bunreacht na hEireann (the Irish Constitution) is the fundamental legal document that sets out how Ireland should be governed and the rights of Irish citizens
Is doiciméad dlí bunúsach é a dhéanann cur síos ar an mbealach ba chóir Éire a rialú agus ar na cearta saoránach Éireannaigh
Main institutions of the State
Príomh institiúidí an Stáit
The Irish Constitution establishes and describes the main institutions of the State
Déantar cur síos anseo ar phríomh institiúidí na hÉireann
Fundamental Rights under the Irish Constitution
Bunchearta faoi Bhunreacht na hÉireann
The Irish Constitution recognises and declares that you have certain fundamental personal rights
Deir an Bunreacht go bhfuil bunchearta pearsanta ar leith agat agus tugann sé aitheantas dóibh
These are confirmed and protected by the Constitution
Is cearta iad seo a bhaineann leis an gcine daonna, is cearta nádúrtha daonna iad agus dearbhaíonn an Bunreacht iad agus tugann sé cosaint dóibh
The Constitutional Convention, set up in 2012, consisted of 66 'ordinary' citizens, 33 political representatives and a chairman
Bhí an Tionól Bunreachtúil, a cuireadh ar bun in 2012, comhdhéanta díobh seo a leanas: 66 ‘gnáthshaoránach’, 33 ionadaí polaitíochta agus cathaoirleach amháin
A Citizens’ Assembly has been established to consider a limited number of issues
Tá Tionól na Saoránach á bhunú chun breithniú le déanamh ar líon teoranta saincheisteanna
Most Read in "Government in Ireland"
Ábhar is mó éilimh i "Rialtas in Éirinn"
Presidential Election in Ireland
Bunchearta faoi Bhunreacht na hÉireann
